heisig_chinese_memo: The turkey used to date the vulture, but now he's moved on to a better life with the chicken. The vulture wanted to spy on them so got rid of the barking St. Bernard dog by giving him some cocoons to eat.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the little bird (隹) is a servant (奚) of the chicken
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The bird meat of choice in China is the chicken.  They eat all of it, including the crotch!
humanum_full_description_en:
Like a chicken, the oracle bone inscriptions deliberately emphasize the comb and the open beak. Later, because the shape of the font is easy to mix with other birds, the sound symbol " Xi " is added. The original meaning is chicken. After adding sound symbols to " chicken ", the pictographic part is no longer used to express meaning, so the chicken-like part is classified as " bird ". Both the Qi and Chu characters of the Warring States Period were changed from " Bird ", and the characters below Qin were changed to "隹" (Ji Xusheng). "Shuowen": "Chicken, know the time and beast. Cong Yu, Xi Sheng. Chicken, Laiwen chicken, Cong bird."

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as place names, "Collection" 37363: "Frogs, there is no disaster." The whole sentence refers to hunting in chicken fields, and there is no disaster.

Bamboo slips of the Warring States period, Qin slips, and Han silk scripts are all used as the original meaning, referring to chickens. "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. Chronicles" Jane 45: "In December Jiawu, when the chickens crowed, they were happy to give birth." "Mawangdui silk book." "Miscellaneous Remedies" line 43: "Destroy the chicken eggs, pour the juice into the wine, scratch, and drink it." In addition, " chicken " can be referred to as " brook ", referring to the valley, "Mawangdui Silk Book. The 65th line of Laozi's Second Edition: "Knowing Qi (its) male, guarding his female, is the world chicken (xi)." "Mawangdui Silk Book. "Laozi Jiaben" is " xi " and Fu Yi is " xi ". The whole sentence refers to knowing that the male is strong, but comfortable with the feminine, as the stream of the world.
humanum_short_description_en: Like a chicken, the oracle bone inscriptions deliberately emphasize the comb and the open beak. Later, because the shape of the font is easy to mix with other birds, the sound symbol " Xi " is added. The original meaning is chicken.
humanum_full_description:
象雞形，甲骨文刻意強調雞冠與張開的喙，後因字形易與其他鳥類相混，故加「奚」作聲符。本義為雞。「雞」在加上聲符以後，不再單靠象形的部分來表意，因此象雞形的部分就類化為「鳥」。戰國文字齊系、楚系字形均從「鳥」，秦文字以下才改從「隹」(季旭昇)。《說文》：「雞，知時畜也。从隹，奚聲。鷄，籒文雞，从鳥。」

　　甲骨文用作地名，《合集》37363：「田雞，往來亡(無)災。」全句指到雞地田獵，往來都沒有災禍。

　　戰國竹簡、秦簡、漢帛書均用作本義，指雞隻。《睡虎地秦簡．編年記》簡45：「十二月甲午雞鳴時，喜產。」《馬王堆帛書．雜療方》第43行：「毀雞卵，注汁酒中，撓，飲之。」另，「雞」可通假為「谿」，指溪谷，《馬王堆帛書．老子乙本》第65行：「知亓(其)雄，守其雌，為天下雞(谿)。」《馬王堆帛書．老子甲本》作「溪」，傅奕本作「谿」。全句指深知雄強，卻安於雌柔，作為天下的川溪。
humanum_short_description: 象雞形，甲骨文刻意強調雞冠與張開的喙，後因字形易與其他鳥類相混，故加「奚」作聲符。本義為雞。

象雞形，甲骨文刻意強調雞冠與張開的喙，後因字形易與其他鳥類相混，故加「 奚 」作聲符。本義為雞。「 雞 」在加上聲符以後，不再單靠象形的部分來表意，因此象雞形的部分就類化為「 鳥 」。戰國文字齊系、楚系字形均從「 鳥 」，秦文字以下才改從「 隹 」(季旭昇)。《說文》：「雞，知時畜也。从隹，奚聲。鷄，籒文雞，从鳥。」 甲骨文用作地名，《合集》37363：「田雞，往來亡(無)災。」全句指到雞地田獵，往來都沒有災禍。 戰國竹簡、秦簡、漢帛書均用作本義，指雞隻。《睡虎地秦簡．編年記》簡45：「十二月甲午雞鳴時，喜產。」《馬王堆帛書．雜療方》第43行：「毀雞卵，注汁酒中，撓，飲之。」另，「 雞 」可通假為「 谿 」，指溪谷，《馬王堆帛書．老子乙本》第65行：「知亓(其)雄，守其雌，為天下雞(谿)。」《馬王堆帛書．老子甲本》作「 溪 」，傅奕本作「 谿 」。全句指深知雄強，卻安於雌柔，作為天下的川溪。

The original meaning is chicken. After adding sound symbols to " chicken", the pictographic part is no longer used to express meaning, so the chicken-like part is classified as " bird". Both the Qi and Chu characters of the Warring States Period were changed from " Bird", and the characters below Qin were changed to " 隹" (Ji Xusheng). "Shuowen": "Chicken, know the time and beast. Cong Yu, Xi Sheng. Chicken, Laiwen chicken, Cong bird." The oracle bone inscriptions are used as place names, "Collection" 37363: "Frogs, there is no disaster." The whole sentence refers to hunting in chicken fields, and there is no disaster. Bamboo slips of the Warring States period, Qin slips, and Han silk scripts are all used as the original meaning, referring to chickens. "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. Chronicles" Jane 45: "In December Jiawu, when the chickens crowed, they were happy to give birth." "Mawangdui silk book." "Miscellaneous Remedies" line 43: "Destroy the chicken eggs, pour the juice into the wine, scratch, and drink it." In addition, " chicken" can be referred to as " brook", referring to the valley, "Mawangdui Silk Book. The 65th line of Laozi's Second Edition: "Knowing Qi (its) male, guarding his female, is the world chicken (xi)." "Mawangdui Silk Book. "Laozi Jiaben" is " xi" and Fu Yi is " xi". The whole sentence refers to knowing that the male is strong, but comfortable with the feminine, as the stream of the world.

雞字的基本解释

雞
jī
同“鸡”。

雞字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jī］
［《廣韻》古奚切，平齊，見。］
亦作“鷄1”。
(1)家禽之一种。品种极多。嘴短，上喙稍弯曲，头部有鲜红色肉质的冠。翅膀短，不能高飞。也叫家鸡。肉、卵可食。
(2)十二生肖之一，与十二地支的酉相配。

雞字的康熙字典解释

【戌集中】【隹字部】　雞； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页1369第02
【唐韻】古兮切【集韻】【韻會】堅奚切【正韻】堅溪切，?音稽。【說文】知時畜也。【玉篇】司晨鳥。【爾雅·釋畜】雞大者蜀。蜀子雓，未成雞僆，絕有力奮。【疏】此別雞屬也。【春秋·說題辭】曰：雞爲積陽，南方之象，火陽精物炎上，故陽出雞鳴，以類感也。【易·說卦】巽爲雞。【書·泰誓】牝雞無晨。【周禮·春官·大宗伯】六摯，工商執雞。【禮·曲禮】雞曰翰音。　又【爾雅·釋鳥】鶾，天雞【註】鶾雞赤羽。【逸周書】文鶾若彩雞，成王時蜀人獻之。　又【爾雅·釋蟲】螒，天雞。【註】小蟲，黑身赤頭，一名莎雞，又曰樗雞。【詩·豳風】六月莎雞振羽。【爾雅翼】一名梭雞。一名酸雞。　又雞人，官名。【周禮·春官·雞人】掌共雞牲，辨其物，大祭祀夜嘑旦，以嘂百官。　又【禮·明堂位】灌尊，夏后氏以雞彝。　又地名。【春秋·襄三年】同盟于雞澤。【註】在廣平曲梁縣西南。又【昭二十三年】吳敗頓胡、沈蔡、?許之師于雞父。【註】雞父，楚地。【戰國策】負雞次之典。【前漢·地理志】鬱林郡，雍雞縣。　又姓。【

雞字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
雞字的起名意思

暂无。

Chickens
Basic explanation of words
Chickens
jī
Same as "chicken".
Chickens
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jī］
["Guangyun" ancient Xi cut, level, see. ]
Also known as "Chicken 1".
(1) A kind of poultry. There are many varieties. The mouth is short, the upper beak is slightly curved, and the head has a bright red fleshy crown. The wings are short and cannot fly high. Also called chicken. Meat and eggs are edible.
(2) One of the twelve zodiac signs, which matches the unitary of the twelve earthly branches.
Chickens
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[戌集] [Fu Character Department] 　 Chicken; Kangxi Strokes: 18; Page Number: Page 1369 No. 02
[Tang Yun] Ancient Xi cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Jian Xi cut [Zheng Yun] Jian Xi cut,? Yin Ji. [Said the text] Know the time of the animal. [Jade articles] Si Chenniao. 【Erya·Shi Hu】The big chicken is Shu. Shu Ziluo, who has not become a chicken, is extremely hardworking. [Sparse] This is also a chicken. [Spring and Autumn·Speech] Say: The chicken is the accumulation of yang, the elephant of the south, the fire yang essence is inflamed, so the yang produces the cock crowing, which is also like feeling. [Easy·Said Gua] Xun is a chicken. [Book·Thai Oath] The chicken has no morning. 【Zhou Li·Chun Guan·Da Zong Bo】Six Zhi, the industrial and commercial performer. 【Rite·Song Li】The chicken is called Hanyin.　[Erya·Shiniao] 鶾, Tianji [Note] 鶾鶾 Chiba. [Book of Yi Zhou] Wen Qian is like a colorful chicken, presented by the people of Shu when he became a king.　[Erya·Shu Chong] 螒, Tianji. [Note] Little bug, black body and naked head, a Shaji, and also known as a barnyard chicken. 【Poetry·Binfeng】In June, Shaji vibrates its feathers. [Er Yayi] A shuttlecock. A sour chicken.　Rooster again, official name. [Zhou Li·Chun Guan·Rooster Man] Palms the chickens together, distinguishes their objects, and sacrifices to the night and scorpions, in order to call upon hundreds of officials.　[Rite·Mingtang] Guan Zun, Xiahou clan used chicken and Yi.　Also place name. 【Spring and Autumn·Xiang Three Years】Allied in Jize. [Note] In the southwest of Quliang County, Quang Binh. Also [Twenty-Three Years in Zhao] Wu defeated Dunhu, Shen Cai, and Xu Zhi from his father. [Note] Father Chicken, Chu Di. [Warring States Policy] The classic of negative chicken. [Former Han·Geography] Yulin County, Yongji County.　Another last name. 【
